Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is grey in section, interior spotted with a black resinous substance, with remains of twelve lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, very smudged and worn, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.99)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87606) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87606)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 108 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
